text: The 1997–98 Macedonian First League was the 6th season of the Macedonian First Football League, the highest football league of Macedonia. The first matches of the season were played on 10 August 1997 and the last on 31 May 1998. Sileks defended their championship title, having won their third title in a row. == Promotion and relegation == {|style="border:0;width:69%;" |-style="vertical-align:top;" | ; At the start of the 1997–98 season Promoted from 1996–97 Second League * Skopje (Winners; West) * Borec (Winners; East) Relegated to 1997–98 Second League * Shkëndija (13th) * Rudar Probishtip (14th) | ; At the end of the 1997–98 season Promoted from 1997–98 Second League * Rabotnichki Kometal (Winners; West) * Osogovo (Winners; East) Relegated to 1998–99 Second League * Belasica (13th) * Bregalnica Shtip (14th)1 |} 1 Bregalnica Shtip was removed from the league after the round 19, due to the absence in a match against Sloga Jugomagnat.
